title: Accessibility
content:
The following features are available to make the product accessible to all users, including those who have low vision, no vision, or limited ability to use a keyboard or mouse.

Accessibility improvements

This release brings new accessibility improvements for Service Portal. The UI elements and interactive items are enhanced, making interactive and navigation elements easily accessible by assistive technologies.

  • Interactive elements such as buttons, dropdowns, and filters come with clear, meaningful names and roles.
  • Error messages and input guidance offer helpful feedback for invalid or unsupported values, especially in date fields and file uploads.
  • All input fields and controls include accurate labels and simple instructions. Streamlined announcements highlight key information for more intuitive experience.
  • The UI elements are enhanced to provide a better color contrast for visually impaired users. This includes the OOB colors defined in the Standard theme. 
  • Instruction contents are added to some forms, which can describe how to complete these forms.
  • When the contents are truncated due to a length limit, tooltips are available to display the full text.
  • Some links are underlined to distinguish them from regular text and make them easier to identify.
  • All links use clear, descriptive text to help screen reader users understand the destination of each link.
  • The assistive label aligns with the labels for dropdowns and buttons. This helps users understand the available options and actions.
  • The main menu includes a quick navigation tip that supports multiple ways to enhance navigation and accessibility. When users press CTRL+SHIFT+A, it opens a dropdown list on the Home page that displays all available modules in the Service Portal. Users can press ENTER to open or search for a module.

Keyboard navigation

The following keyboard shortcuts are available in Service Management and Service Portal.

Task Shortcut
Navigation between UI components and forms Tab: Navigate to next field
Shift + Tab: Navigate to previous field
Opens combo box list Enter
Navigation within a toolbar/record list Arrow keys
Select previous or next item in the list Up/Down key
New record Alt+N
View record details Alt+V
Open the comment box (in a record) Alt+C
Open the chat conversation window Alt+Z
Save record Ctrl+S
Save record and close record page Ctrl+Shift+S

Go to the selected tab (in a record)

Example: Alt+0 goes to the General tab

 Alt+number from the main keyboard
Insert an ASCII character Alt+ number from the numeric keypad
Select multiple records in a record list

Shift+Down/Up arrow key

Note: In full keyboard navigation case (without mouse), when you use this shortcut in a non-popup record list, you can only select 2 records at most.
Jump to… Ctrl+Shift+A
Go to global search Ctrl+/
Save action in dialog boxes Ctrl+Enter
View details of selected search result Alt+V
After selecting an article from search results, add the article to favorites Ctrl+Shift+F

Limitation

  • The header row in the grid is not reachable using keyboard navigation.
  • When you use the Firefox browser, the second item in the To-do card is not reachable using keyboard navigation.

Keyboard shortcuts for rich-text editor

The editor toolbar can be accessed by using the ALT+F10 keyboard combination and then navigating through the icons using the TAB key.

Keyboard shortcuts for Live Support

To use keyboard shortcuts in Live Support, see Keyboard shortcuts in Live Support and Accessibility support for Chat.

Keyboard shortcuts for Operations Orchestration (OO) Workflow Designer

To use keyboard shortcuts in Operations Orchestration (OO) Workflow Designer, see Keyboard shortcuts for OO Workflow Designer.

Screen reader support

Service Management and Service Portal are compatible with screen reader software used by blind and the visually impaired users on supported Windows operating systems.

To enable screen reader accessibility, you must install supported screen reader software on your local client.

Supported screen reader software

Service Management supports the following screen reader software on supported Windows operating systems:

  • JAWS Screen Reader software version 14 and later.

Supported browsers

  • Latest Chrome

Areas with screen reader support

Screen reader accessibility is supported in all components of a record's General detail sections such as text boxes and combo boxes.

Limitations

  • The accessible name of the Network quality icon can be read out by NVDA and JAWS 2022, but cannot be read out by JAWS 2024. 
    When you use Firefox with NVDA, the accessible name of Network quality icon will be read twice. 
  • In some drop down list fields, the Clear button for the selected items is not accessible to keyboard users. In this case, keyboard only users can use the BACKSPACE key to remove the selected items. 
  • When Angular is upgraded to version 17 in Service Portal, if the keyboard focus is on a drop down list with value filled and the value can be removed by the Clear button, you cannot use SHIFT+TAB to navigate back to the previous component.
